ul.li:

Kingdom - Plants - Plantae

Class - Dicots - Dicotyledoneae
Order - Maple / Sumac / Creosotebush - Sapindales
Family - Maples - Aceraceae
Species - Box-elder - Acer negundo

img.data-title: Clusters of staminate flowers dangle from leaf axils on this male tree.
The leaves, usually with 3 leaflets that are sparingly and coarsely toothed, may resemble those of poison ivy.

div.br:
Global Rank: G5
State Rank: S5
Agency Status
USFWS:
USFS:
BLM:
MNPS Threat Rank:
C-value: 3
External Links

div.div:
Small dioecious trees to 15 m. Twigs glabrate to pilose. Leaves 3-
or -(rarely)5-foliolate; leaflets pubescent on veins beneath, lanceolate to ovate, coarsely few-toothed, 3–8 cm long; lateral pair asymmetric. Inflorescence: female flowers in pendent racemes from axillary buds; male flowers fascicled. Flowers unisexual, green; sepals ca. 1 mm long; petals absent. Samara 2–3 cm long, the seed ca. 1 cm long (Lesica 2012. Manual of Montana Vascular Plants. BRIT Press. Fort Worth, TX).

br.span: Throughout temperate North America (Lesica 2012. Manual of Montana Vascular Plants. BRIT Press. Fort Worth, TX).

div.p:
Look for this PDF icon at the top of each page as you search and browse. You can download select species by searching or when you're on a Taxa page like Class, Order, and Family.
Here's some links if you want to download a whole group.

a.onclick: DownloadPDF("order=Odonata","Dragonflies and Damselflies of Montana",1,"All Odonata");
